institutional_learning_competencies.name: Critical Thinking and Problem Solving
institutional_learning_competencies.description: Ability to analyze complex problems systematically, evaluate evidence objectively, and develop logical, creative solutions using appropriate methodologies and reasoning skills.

institutional_learning_competencies.name: Technical and Professional Skills
institutional_learning_competencies.description: Proficiency in relevant tools, technologies, methodologies, and professional practices specific to one's field of study, including the ability to adapt to new technologies and industry standards.

institutional_learning_competencies.name: Communication and Collaboration
institutional_learning_competencies.description: Effective written and oral communication skills, including the ability to present complex ideas clearly, work collaboratively in diverse teams, and engage constructively with different perspectives.

institutional_learning_competencies.name: Research and Information Literacy
institutional_learning_competencies.description: Ability to locate, evaluate, synthesize, and effectively use information from diverse sources, while understanding research methodologies and maintaining academic integrity.

institutional_learning_competencies.name: Quantitative and Analytical Reasoning
institutional_learning_competencies.description: Competency in mathematical thinking, statistical analysis, data interpretation, and the application of quantitative methods to solve problems and make informed decisions.

institutional_learning_competencies.name: Creativity and Innovation
institutional_learning_competencies.description: Capacity to generate original ideas, approach problems from novel perspectives, design innovative solutions, and adapt creatively to changing circumstances and challenges.

institutional_learning_competencies.name: Ethical Reasoning and Social Responsibility
institutional_learning_competencies.description: Understanding of ethical principles and their application to professional and personal decisions, with awareness of social, cultural, and environmental responsibilities.

institutional_learning_competencies.name: Global and Cultural Awareness
institutional_learning_competencies.description: Appreciation for diverse perspectives, cultures, and global issues, with the ability to work effectively in multicultural environments and understand global interconnections.

institutional_learning_competencies.name: Leadership and Initiative
institutional_learning_competencies.description: Ability to motivate and guide others, take responsibility for outcomes, demonstrate initiative in identifying and addressing challenges, and contribute positively to organizational goals.

institutional_learning_competencies.name: Adaptability and Lifelong Learning
institutional_learning_competencies.description: Capacity to adjust to new situations, learn continuously, reflect on experiences for improvement, and maintain relevance in a rapidly changing professional landscape.

scoring_scale.0-2: Not relevant - No clear connection to the competency
scoring_scale.3-4: Minimally relevant - Slight or indirect connection
scoring_scale.5-6: Moderately relevant - Some clear connections with room for development
scoring_scale.7-8: Highly relevant - Strong alignment with multiple aspects of competency
scoring_scale.9-10: Exceptionally relevant - Comprehensive coverage and deep engagement

evidence_requirements: Explicit learning objectives that align with competency
Course activities and assignments that develop the competency
Assessment methods that measure competency achievement
Clear progression of skill development throughout the course
quality_indicators: Multiple opportunities for skill practice and development
Integration of competency across different course modules
